result.execSummary:
The defendant Nevada L. Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA sample

No use of alcohol

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nevada L. Webster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:25 p.m. Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA, no possession or use of controlled subst. w/o prescription, 30 days jail, court costs. No use of alcohol. Def agrees.  Plea quest. reviewed. No contest plea to ct 1. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 2. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Debord satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Atty Debord asks for 21 days credit if revoked, huber and time to report. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, No possession of controlled subst w/o valid prescr. No use of alcohol. 30 days jail, huber, report no later than 1/6/17 @ 7 p.m. DNA sample and surcharge. Apply bond, return balance to poster. Credit for 21 days served if revoked. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.
of Preliminary Examination

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:52 p.m. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews with Defendant. Court finds waiver knowing & voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, not guilty pleas to each ct. Court receives pleas and directs entry into record. 2:58 Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record on @ 2:59 Matter set for plea & sentencing. If matter won't be resolved, Atty Debord to contact JA and schedule trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Amended Bail Bond

Defendant Nevada L. Webster not in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:14 p.m. Family posted bond yesterday after checking that Def not being held for other reasons. However, there is warrant in Marathon Co. Court orders COC to return cash bond to poster.

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court via video with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Nevada L. Webster in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews court record.  Review of bond.  Statement by Atty Debord.  Arguments for bond.  Court will reduce bond.  Def to take care of traffic citations.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Bail Bond

ADDRESS INFO for Nevada L. Webster
Current: PO Box 844, Keshena, WI   (Effective: 07-20-2016)
Prior: 3055 Hwy 47, Neopit, WI

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court, via video, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dodge has been appointed however atty is not present.  Def is requesting a new atty.  Court will adjourn.  Bond has been set at $2500.00.  Arguments presented by def for bond modification.  Arguments by Atty Bayne-Allison for bond to remain.  Court will reduce bond  Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nevada L. Webster
Current: 3055 Hwy 47, Neopit, WI   (Effective: 07-12-2016)
Prior: 2625 Warrington Road, Keshena, WI 54135

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 1:20 pm.  Warrant vacated.   State gives bond recommendation.  Def. makes statement. Court orders $2,500.00  cash bond. Def. advised of atty rights. Def. makes statement.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Copy to parties 6-2-15

Defendant Nevada L. Webster not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter called 3:11 pm  Notices have been set to def and poster.  Court will forfeit bond to Langlade County.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing

Defendant Nevada L. Webster not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls on own motion @ 9:32 am.  State request warrant, body only. Court authorize wararnt body only, statewid.  State moves to forfiet bond, & Court authorize pending hearing.

Defendant Nevada L. Webster in court with attorney Alec Nocco.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Special appearance by Atty Nocco.  Complaint received.  Waive reading  Reserved jurisdictional objections.  Time limit for preliminary waived.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Bond Receipt
Clerk's Minutes filed.
